column4: okay guys now i got the drive mounted but only root is able to see it. it's read only which i know cuz it's ntfs. so it won't let me change any of the permissions on it any ideas?
well the other users can see the drive, just not view it's contents
You can remount it. Still if this is something you want to do a lot, add a correct line to fstab including either a "user" option or a gid/uid for someone who should be able to read it.
If it's user, then you need to mount it with the user that will read it, not with root. Umount it, and remount with the user ("mount /mnt/Drive1" only or it'll fail)
